intro: Nothofagus stylosa, commonly known as the slender nothofagus, is a species of evergreen tree native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Nothofagus genus, which is part of the beech family, Fagaceae. This plant typically grows in cool, moist environments, often in rainforests or understorey habitats. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a distinct midrib, while its cones are small and clustered. The tree plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
